Host a potluck dinner: Instead of preparing everything yourself, invite family members to bring their favorite dishes to share. This way, the workload is distributed and you can enjoy a variety of delicious foods.

Cook with your family: Turn the preparation of the holiday dinner into a fun family activity. Assign tasks to each family member, such as chopping vegetables or setting the table. This will not only make the process more enjoyable, but also create lasting memories.

Use a slow cooker: A slow cooker is a great way to cook a large meal without having to constantly monitor it. Prepare the ingredients the day before and let the slow cooker do the work. This will free up your time and reduce stress.
Make it a pot: Instead of making a full dinner, make a potluck of dishes that can be easily reheated. This will save time and effort, and also allow for more variety in the meal.

Hire a caterer: If you're feeling overwhelmed, consider hiring a caterer to handle the meal preparation. This will not only save you time and effort, but also ensure that the food is of high quality and well-presented.
